body_html:
Did you check on a computer that has multiple cores?

I created a GitLab repo with a CI script which can reproduce the bug: https://gitlab.com/ostrokach/pytorch-deadlock.

However, the bug is only reproduced when the docker image is ran on a machine with multiple cores (see: 119515407). It runs fine on a machine with only one core (see: 119522205). Using numpy from the defaults channel works fine in both cases (see 119515408 and 119522206, respectively).
body_text:
Did you check on a computer that has multiple cores?
I created a GitLab repo with a CI script which can reproduce the bug: https://gitlab.com/ostrokach/pytorch-deadlock.
However, the bug is only reproduced when the docker image is ran on a machine with multiple cores (see: 119515407). It runs fine on a machine with only one core (see: 119522205). Using numpy from the defaults channel works fine in both cases (see 119515408 and 119522206, respectively).
body:
Did you check on a computer that has multiple cores?

I created a GitLab repo with a CI script which can reproduce the bug: https://gitlab.com/ostrokach/pytorch-deadlock.

However, the bug is only reproduced when the docker image is ran on a machine with multiple cores (see: [119515407](https://gitlab.com/ostrokach/pytorch-deadlock/-/jobs/119515407)). It runs fine on a machine with only one core (see: [119522205](https://gitlab.com/ostrokach/pytorch-deadlock/-/jobs/119522205)). Using numpy from the `defaults` channel works fine in both cases (see [119515408](https://gitlab.com/ostrokach/pytorch-deadlock/-/jobs/119515408) and [119522206](https://gitlab.com/ostrokach/pytorch-deadlock/-/jobs/119522206), respectively).
